document.title: Health Education Standards of Learning for Virginia Public Schools

E11F1D63AC4944B7AD98AA1172BA59A0.description:
Analyze opportunities for community service and advocacy for policies that promote
environmental health.

BE2F9F3F7AF4444D9951DBC1CDA8A1CD.description:
Describe ways for students to develop relationships that are positive, promote wellness,
and prevent weapon use, physical violence, and gang involvement.

79A556BF03DE4154B76303386A51F8B4.description:
Recommend strategies to prevent, safely defend oneself and others, or get help with
bullying.

1F27D0F984844D5FA89A890BA0600738.description: Promote the availability of school and community mental health resources.

24E1AF0DB4454B89B51B9E8BB1A61F7A.description:
Explain the effects of stigma on accessing help and assistance for mental illnesses and
emotional challenges.

F00A42C409D74038AC345E53139EC1FD.description:
Identify and recognize family, school, and community resources for helping oneself and
others with mental health needs.

5278EB918ECA41A791150150D45B0020.description: Ability to develop safe, respectful, and responsible relationships.

BF794993873A46DB9AF06AE961C5CCC6.description:
Analyze a variety of situations to determine when to use refusal and negotiation skills
to avoid risk.

2AECD89D6B1F4C0D9871E86341FD81C9.description: Develop and promote guidelines for using social media.

B33C5CABD236457E895C1BB11F981310.description: Develop appropriate personal guidelines for online gaming and social media use.

EEE0BA53DB974A8CBB38862696F040EA.description:
Develop a personal action plan during an emergency situation for a variety of locations
outside of school (e.g., shopping areas, recreation areas).

E8805CA1652B4087B530918E50F50C05.description:
Create a campaign that emphasizes the importance of prevention and early
identification of drug use disorder.

6EC18CA0F7CF471391B114D41E366EF8.description: Design persuasive advertising to eliminate drug use.

F2DA11DD0259428A96DC894B1DA7171C.description:
Design a plan of action with short- and long-term goals to prevent diabetes, heart
disease, stroke, cancer, obesity, and other chronic diseases and conditions.

6ED6F4CDB4C34D59A8115D4519E650DF.description:
Create Specific, Measurable, Attainable, Relevant and Timely (S.M.A.R.T.) goals to
get optimal sleep to promote cognitive performance and academic success.

581E43DA49DD4F078AE9A06FE37AA027.description: Create environmental design solutions that promote physical and mental health.

6A1B034BC3E6403CAEEBB52D1A5B6040.description:
Develop factual advertising to help family and peers evaluate healthy food and
beverage choices.

41C6A4DC208B4ECC84637BFA3ACAFE7A.description: Identify and promote resources for help and assistance with disordered eating.

33620E475C604D719EFADDBED366D0AD.description: Create strategies to promote food safety at home.

6269A899C64C4F9A9A349B98EE392D57.description:
Create a plan to make healthy food choices, including choosing fruits and vegetables
and increasing water and healthy beverage choices in a variety of settings.

5DA9832D9F6449928BBF0582A0DE22D0.description: Design strategies to protect and promote brain and nervous system health.

C75CA9A2B73E4194892FA1232D8327BD.description:
The student will undertake health-promotion activities that demonstrate an understanding
of the relationship between nutrition, physical activity, and emotional and physical health.

4E42966F49404C12A16F997FD4B7E838.description: Explain how humans and the environment are interdependent.

9E08310603A548CC99C86B0AB3DD6B84.description:
Analyze the risks associated with weapon use, physical violence, and gang-related
activities for oneself, the family, and the community.

F9EFC1E247194BECAAA635C05EE5F3A8.description: Explain the effects of bullying on individuals, including vulnerable populations.

FFD671EF7A7243739683C87B3C2706F2.description:
Describe the role of mental health professionals in schools (e.g., school counselors,
psychologists, social workers).

33A122785B804187B91CE43A3B97DFCD.description:
Explain how negative perceptions of mental health promote a stigma about mental
illnesses and emotional challenges.

08E31F12CD5740E9814D8C3603DF8A4C.description:
Explain why mental health issues such as self-harm behaviors, depression, and suicide
ideation cannot be managed independently and require support/assistance.

ADF413B5537347E1AFF5808824338B6E.description:
Explain the importance of developing relationships that are positive and promote
wellness.

3BBD76534EFE4AFCB799F49ECB37FCC3.description:
Explain the benefits of using refusal and negotiation skills for a variety of risk-taking
situations.

6019202C5CD4434DBA80B482BCBD48E3.description: Identify personal stress-management skills that help respond to different kinds of stress.

99482A905C554C028162A2C301CDD389.description: Develop strategies to assess and manage the effects of social media use.

C021A893F49F4F43B21EB618EB14AC6C.description:
Explain the role of decision making when faced with potentially harmful situations
when using the Internet, online gaming, and social media.

DA24400325CB4BC8982369D0AB5C9435.description:
Explain the potential consequences of following and not following safety protocols for
school drills.

EA884782CA6443068980EF20D7BAF3C7.description:
Have and express positive norms regarding why most teenagers do not use alcohol,
tobacco, prescription opioids, or other drugs (e.g., do not think use and abuse are
acceptable or appropriate).

706E4B39E077405BB34250A38F4CFC04.description:
Analyze the social, economic, and family and peer pressure influences on the use of
tobacco, nicotine products (e.g., e-cigarettes), alcohol, marijuana, and other drugs.

30A87917747D469FA49B2226D5B42217.description:
Describe preventive health measures, including immunizations, regular health and
medical screenings, nutrition, physical activity, sleep, and limiting personal technology
use, in preventing diabetes, heart disease, stroke, cancer, obesity, and other chronic
diseases.

8E52C4BAEA854E04983523FD5ABEBD4A.description: Identify sleep hygiene strategies to support recommendations for optimal sleep.

8722932E70AE4178B3374F05649EB16C.description: Assess the health risks of a sedentary lifestyle.

CCA3F5BD998945869A2BBE61546CF373.description:
Evaluate the accuracy of claims about trending diets, dietary supplements, and popular
beverages.

54895994FB5B4BCCA949493BCC20F736.description:
Analyze the impact of society (i.e., media, family, peers) on eating habits and attitudes
toward weight and body size.

7B029EEF5E05487C96BA838A35632BAC.description:
Describe food safety techniques (e.g., hand washing, food washing, cross
contamination, proper handling and storing of foods).

9F2D900049864C0CAA04C203B59D4A50.description: Explain how nutrients contribute to brain function.

EAB9FCE6DFAD4E6DAE44ECB8D55EB11C.description: Describe ways to maintain brain and nervous system health.

482E1A22FEFC41BB87CF7368D69C7DF1.description:
The student will apply health concepts and skills to the management of personal and family
health.

2BE988F5D2FD4035BC7BDFC061EBD9F3.description: Define and describe renewable resources and sustainable energy.

9C968648F68248049E39ADDDCEE56C97.description: Identify the consequences of weapon use, physical violence, and gang involvement.

53D5D3CD79E748428D36010DC146D5D5.description:
Differentiate between bullying behaviors, arguments, peer conflict, harassment, teasing,
taunting, and joking situations.

C8EA68CE02A248D7958D1A6EE0743CE7.description:
Identify and describe careers associated with mental health care (e.g., social worker,
psychologist, psychiatrist).

0E1231A111BE4A72B921BC7B078C50E7.description:
Identify factors that can influence mental health (e.g., family, environment, trauma,
genetics, brain chemistry, health behaviors, nutrition, personal values, peers, media,
technology, culture, community).

3939C91E84E247F8AB1811CD132925C0.description:
Describe the warning signs, risk factors, and protective factors for self-harm behaviors,
depression, and suicide.

5506A7F1A8FC441691323FBC35CC62BB.description:
Describe characteristics of healthy and unhealthy relationships, including establishing
and communicating boundaries.

6800CD43AE0947EEB99860BCA5DAD0B8.description: List the skills and strategies for refusal and negotiation.

753D7BA9EFFC49C3934C8E686B69CC6D.description: Describe how to assess levels of stress based on physical and psychological responses.

DBAAEEC0E88048CA96DF5C0A5387A04E.description: Identify the benefits and risks of social media.

6881DDD67F414989A8125B20BF413FB0.description:
Identify risky behaviors associated with Internet use, online gaming, and social media
use.

BF02F61F408140F3B481987A6AA22375.description: Explain the need for school safety drills and procedures.

0FA59BBB8F334A7A9EB55E53CD68907B.description:
Research the signs, symptoms, and causes of addiction and the impact of substance use
disorder on relationships and behavior.

E78C6EABE06D4856B3F7B2BE1EE30642.description:
Describe the short- and long-term health issues and effects on the brain related to the
use of alcohol, tobacco, nicotine products, and other drugs, including inhalants,
marijuana, cocaine, stimulants, methamphetamines, opiates, steroids, and performanceenhancing drugs.

43435DF347ED4728A73A544839043B4E.description:
Identify environmental and personal factors that influence the degree of risk of
diabetes, heart disease, cancer, obesity, and stroke.

4B83EB9CBD93438AB03F20518B1B588D.description: Explain the difference between rest, sleep, sleep deprivation, and sleep debt.

90575BE37C064EC4AD211CB35C2E8D53.description: Evaluate the physical, mental, and social health benefits of physical activity.

FD36BA613DCF47F78D589193A66D991E.description:
Compare health benefits and risks associated with trending diets, dietary supplements,
and popular beverages, including sugar-sweetened and caffeinated beverages.

CD2DA3AF95C148C3BCCF31192EB9ACC5.description: Identify the nutritional impact of disordered eating.

6E7DBB606EE54EAF8C704E9F35756C85.description:
Examine the health risks posed by food contaminants during food preparation and food
storage.

7C518D729B5D4813B5FF67C4CBA992AD.description: Determine the nutrients needed for proper brain function.

5478DCD389924D1882FB42EF3EB6A5D9.description:
Identify and describe the major structures and functions of the brain and nervous
system and identify brain and nervous system disorders.

3926AB871ADE486C81BFC55B97A14F94.description:
The student will identify and explain essential health concepts to demonstrate an
understanding of personal health.
